{ "step_by_step_thinking": "Acute leukemia in children is most commonly of the lymphoblastic variety, so option D is true. It can cause obvious purpura due to the decrease in platelets, making option C true. It may also manifest as mucosal pallor due to anemia, which makes option B true. However, gross gingival swelling is not a characteristic symptom of acute leukemia in children, making option A false.", "answer_choice": "A" }
